cyclone.name: HERMINE
cyclone.current_location: about 135 miles SSW of Apalachicola, Florida
cyclone.trajectory: moving north-northeast, expected to cross Florida’s Big Bend tonight then track northeastward just inland/along the Southeast U.S. coast before emerging offshore of the Mid-Atlantic coast late Saturday night–Sunday
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: Florida Big Bend coast between Suwannee River and Mexico Beach

weather_observation.watch_coast: Tropical Storm Watch north of Surf City NC to Oregon Inlet NC, including Pamlico Sound
weather_observation.warning_coast: Tropical Storm Warning Englewood FL to Suwannee River FL, Mexico Beach FL to Walton/Bay County line FL, and Flagler/Volusia County line FL to Surf City NC; Hurricane Warning Suwannee River FL to Mexico Beach FL
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Florida Gulf Coast, entire Southeast coast, and Mid-Atlantic coast up through New Jersey/New York
weather_observation.wind: 20–30% chance of sustained tropical-storm-force winds (≥34 kt) Sunday; peak gusts 35–45 mph possible
weather_observation.storm_surge: None expected along Delaware Bay; minor tidal anomalies (<3 ft) possible
weather_observation.rainfall: Bands of heavy rain possible Sunday with totals generally 2–4 inches
weather_observation.other_hazards: High surf, dangerous rip currents, and minor coastal flooding during high tide cycles Sunday–Monday
